greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of Sum_{k=1..n} 1/(2*k-1)^2.
comment: a((p-1)/2) is divisible by prime p > 3.
The limit of the rationals r(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} 1/(2*k-1)^2, for n -> infinity, is (Pi^2)/8 = (1 - 1/2^2)*Zeta(2), which is approximately 1.233700550.

r(n) = (Psi(1, 1/2) - Psi(1, n+1/2))/4 for n >= 1, where Psi(n,k) = Polygamma(n,k) is the n-th derivative of the digamma function. Psi(1, 1/2) = 3*Zeta(2) = Pi^2/2. - _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 02 2013 [Corrected by _Petros Hadjicostas_, May 09 2020]
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..300
formula: a(n) = numerator( Pi^2/2 - Zeta(2,(2n+1)/2) ) / 4 for n > 0. - _Artur Jasinski_, Mar 03 2010 [corrected by _Bruno Berselli_, Dec 02 2013]
mathematica: Table[(PolyGamma[1, 1/2] - PolyGamma[1, n+1/2])/4 // Numerator, {n, 1, 15}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 02 2013 *)
program: (MAGMA) [Numerator((&+[1/(2*k-1)^2: k in [1..n]])): n in [1..20]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 23 2018
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jul 01 2006
